website_summaries.verdict: A nice set of multi-ethnic puppets to use with kids.
pros: Eight human puppets with movable mouths
Good for storytelling or puppet shows with children
A practical set for the price
Full bodies and cute clothes on the human-looking puppets
cons: A good price for so many puppets in a set, but the quality could be better

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money looking at these
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered these hand puppets I thought it would be similar to the ones a friend had bought for church. The size of the puppets according to this listing was the same as the ones we had at church and they looked pretty similar, so I thought they would be a match, but no. These puppets were smaller and the quality was horrible. the hair (made of yarn) fell out and it was hard even for the kids who were using the puppets to maneuver them. These puppets are not worth $30...Even dolls/stuffed animals/puppets at the local 99 cent stores would have been better quality and cheaper. I'm returning these because of the poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: ALC

customer_reviews.title: The Only Review You Need To Read
customer_reviews.text: This item really is only for entertaining kindergarten-age kids. And their hands are really the only size that could possibly fit easily into them to work them. Right out of the box, one of the dolls started losing their hair, so these dolls aren't meant to last. Maybe good for a few puppet shows for an audience that's really easy to entertain. For me, I just wanted to do a goofy little video for my daughter, and they served their purpose. Can't imagine what else I can do with them because I can barely fit my hands into them. Maybe I'll donate them to a local day care center or elementary school.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Waters

customer_reviews.title: Great functional puppets with diverse ethnicity.
customer_reviews.text: These are great functional puppets with diverse ethnicity which is what I was looking for. Adults easily used these puppets to tell a story. For the price and how many puppets you get it is a great deal. Buying each one separately would have been extremely more costly. For my purposes, story telling, they work great. Not sure how they would hold up as a toy, but that is not my intended purposes. I saw no imperfections with the puppets so I can only comment on what I actually received. I am happy with the purchase. The instructors were happy with the purchase and the kids were happy with the purchase. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: QT

customer_reviews.title: So Much Fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge hit at the one-year old's birthday party. The kids don't play with them on a daily basis so they've held up rather well. I will say that I can see what other reviewers were saying in regards to the hair issues, but for us, it added to the comical appeal of the puppets. The price was awesome. Since the puppeteer we originally planned to hire fell through, it provided a great opportunity for the teens to collaborate, write an age-appropriate skit, and put on a hilarious show that entertained everyone ranging from toddlers to the elderly. Having to unexpectedly put on a last-minute act, the quick delivery was vital and greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: The QT

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid....
customer_reviews.text: Positive: Great turnaround time from ordering to receiving the puppets. The puppet clothing are bright colors. Negative: Very inexpensively made. I was hoping for more defined ethnic features...the Black puppet is a rather orange-brown color, none looks very Asian. The puppets are not easy to use...the mouths are sewed too tight so they don't open and close very efficiently. They are good enough to start the discussion about "differences" with our grandchildren so I am keeping them.
customer_reviews.author: Betty G Wolverton

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to manipulate
customer_reviews.text: These little guys look cute but it's hard to open and close the mouths and next to impossible to move the hands. If you want many of them, you can't beat this price, but if you need something that can actually be a puppet (and not merely a stuffed toy) this isn't what you're looking for
customer_reviews.author: ZR

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the puppets; multi-ethnicity is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.text: So glad I ordered these puppets for my private practice to use in the children theater. They are an excellent price and allow my clients to find a puppet that best represent their ethnicity in their story and narrative development. While not super high-end quality; the price point is low enough that I feel comfortable replacing them as needed without a huge investment. I would highly recommend these puppets for a children's theater setting in practice settings, daycares, and classrooms.
customer_reviews.author: H. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great set of puppets.
customer_reviews.text: Terrific set of puppets -- we switched a number of them to be mermaids and they were delightful! I will certainly order these again for our drama class puppet shows! They are a little hard to operate if you want to use both hands and mouth at the exact same time, but it can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Carel Verden

customer_reviews.title: BUT I loved the puppets themselves soooooo cute
customer_reviews.text: had to send these back...too small for this nannies hands...they came really quick and the return was handled with ease and no issues...BUT I loved the puppets themselves soooooo cute!
customer_reviews.author: Lynette lowery

customer_reviews.title: Great Puppets
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the puppets for my prekindergarten class. I use the puppets as reading buddies in the library and in dramatic play for puppet shows. My students love them. I especially like how ethnically diverse the puppets are. However, the are a bit on the cheap side. A few of the puppets have lost a yarn/strand of hair or two.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia E

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the puppets
customer_reviews.text: This pupputs are not easy to use, there is not too much room for your hand, and I have a small hand, the mouth do not open and close easily. After 30 seconds trying my fingers were hurting. I am a teacher and bought it for Circle Time and not sure I am going to be able to use them. Very disappointed. They are cute thou.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use-even for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: Campers came up with their own play for the final day of camp and they completely enjoyed being a different character! Many different ones to choose from and easy to use even for littler campers! Kids expanded their imagination while completely being able to be “someone” else!
customer_reviews.author: Terri Newsom

customer_reviews.title: Descent
customer_reviews.text: These puppets are bigger than I expected which was great. The material they are made with is cheap feeling and the eyes are super creepy. I am going to use acrylic paint to make them look better. Multicultural toys tend to be very expensive so I do think they were worth the affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: In the spirit of diversity, these hand puppets are fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: Although they were on back-order for almost 2 months, they were well worth the wait! These hand puppets represent the beauty of diversity, which makes them so very special. I saw some earlier comments that complained about poor quality but that was not our experience. The batch we received were well crafted and very durable. I recommend purchasing a stage separately for full benefit. The children absolutely love creating puppet shows to perform for anyone who visits. Just adorable!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: For beginner puppeteers, and too cute!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandchildren, ages 5 through 9. These are not as detailed, perhaps not as high a quality as other hand puppets I've seen while shopping for these. BUT . . . for beginning puppeteers, I think they are quite appropriate and just adorable. They are what I think of as a sort of Muppet style. I also especially liked that there are multiple races represented in the assortment, since two of my grandchildren are adopted from another continent. Too cute! I'd but them again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Very well made--Grandkids loved them! Were perfect fit for kids--adults could squeeze ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made--Grandkids loved them! Were perfect fit for kids--adults could squeeze their hands in with a bit of effort. Should hold up to several kids playing with them--very cute!!
customer_reviews.author: Paula's Daycare

customer_reviews.title: Fun Puppets!!
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice, inexpensive puppets, but are for small hands and little people. The beauty of that is that you can allow even toddlers and pre-schoolers to use them, without worrying about destroying your larger, more expensive puppets. They are lightweight, too, which makes them great for young children. I really like that they are Multi-Ethnic and there are boy and girl puppets. The kids seem to really befriend these puppets. The puppets arrived quickly and were in excellent condition, and they have held up well, considering the price I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied in IN

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price, some technical difficulties
customer_reviews.text: These puppets are great however a couple of them have some issues with their mouths (stuffing and plastic issues). This doesn't bother me as I typically only use 3-4 of them but if you planned on using all of them just be prepared you may have a couple that you'll struggle to open and close their mouths. The price was great for this stash of puppets so I'm only taking 1 star for the mouth malfunctions.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: For the price , I was really tickled. I can’t spend a LOT of money, it is for bible study with kids once a week and it makes them pay attention and want to learn about Jesus. So God bless you for this!
customer_reviews.author: Dana C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: It was almost impossible for an adult to use these puppets and the mouths didn't work. I think you might find it be glad you went elsewhere. There are some amazing puppets (high quality- mouth works, adults can use and the clothes are removable) at Silly Puppets. They are more expensive, but I think they are worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Petwhisperer3

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that my hands would fit into the puppet so that I can use them for learning with my toddler and infant, but I am lucky that I can barely squeeze in my thumb and two fingers to make the puppets talk. Also, I'd advise that you buy googly eyes and stick on them to make them really come alive. Their eyes are this weird satin stitch that gives them a ghostly ghoulish look. Hecked pulled them out the bag and they creeped me out so didn't want to do it to my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: We call them friends - ❤️
customer_reviews.text: Best money spent. My daughter and I have so far played e Trudeau since I got these. We have named all based on their ethnicity and we love them. Thank you for making these so affordable and perfect for a two year old to play.
customer_reviews.author: Val X valencia McKinnon

customer_reviews.title: Not really useable puppets
customer_reviews.text: These puppets are cute, but you can't move their mouths or even their hands. So, to me what good are they if you can't use them in the manner you expected. Sorry, good looking, but unusable in my estimation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality as expected for the price paid
customer_reviews.text: these are fairly cheap puppets, but my son likes them. They are rather large too. Larger than I expected. The picture shows all their mouths closed, but all of our puppets came with the mouths permanently stuck open and even when you put your hand in it is hard to get them closed. The mouths are so big that they are a bit creepy. However, all that being said, my son loves to play puppet theatre with them! So, who am I to complain as an adult? They aren't designed for me! I would give them 2 stars, my son would give them 4 stars, so I chose in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Cute but can't really move their mouths.
customer_reviews.text: Puppets are extremely cute, however there is no space to move their mouths. Even my 4 and 5 year old children could barely fit their hands inside. I reached out to the company about my order being messed up and didn't hear back from them, even after 2 months of waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana Smith

customer_reviews.title: It’s an ok product
customer_reviews.text: The reason for 3 Stars. I brought these puppets to be part of my story time. Once I opened it. Some of the puppets hair was coming off. And if you have large hand, good luck moving it’s mouth. Other than that. Puppets are cute. Don’t know if I could return them.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift for my 6 year old niece. They are very nice for kids to play with. They are not professional quality but they aren't claimed to be either. If you're looking for a nice puppet set for children these are truly wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are cute however I took a little of the stuffing out so that the mouth would move better. I also cute the hair on some to make boys or braided and put bows in.
customer_reviews.author: sher

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality looks really good. They're a Christmas present for my son, so I'm not sure if he likes it yet or not. As a mom I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made and enough variety to work with whatever they ...
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids will be using them to put on a Christmas program for the rest of the family. Nicely made and enough variety to work with whatever they come up with.
customer_reviews.author: brewcitytech

customer_reviews.title: Multicultural puppets make the Best gift!
customer_reviews.text: The puppets are amazing the sewing and time and work people do to make them is a craft. Multi culture puppets are exactly what I needed to show my niece we are all different but united this is for her Bday and she can make a play and learn on her time after school and enjoy. I made the puppet stand w curtain myself all we needed were these cute puppets. Little Sadie Lynn will be thrilled! Tyou Amazon and the people who take the time to make these puppets. Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Cid Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Hours of creative fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this puppet set for my seven year old grandson. He gave his best friend and three of my granddaughters one puppet each and the fun began. Since then they have been playing with them constantly. Making up different characters and stories. These puppets are good quality and a great value. They will bring out the creative side of your child and hour if fun.
customer_reviews.author: John Pack

customer_reviews.title: The opening of the puppet is pretty tight for adult hands
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 1.5 year old niece and she loves them. The opening of the puppet is pretty tight for adult hands,and the mouth is hard to maneuver, but with a good imagination this will not be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Great price!
customer_reviews.text: These puppets are so cute! They are great props for teaching online. So many for so little money! I couldn't have made them for such a low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Guru

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: These are not perfect but for the price you can't beat it. They are very cute and yes they are made for little hands.I hope to be able to teach my grandson with these.I am looking forward to introducing them to him
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: The kids love them.
customer_reviews.text: The kids love these! My only concern is that they may not hold up very long as 1 or 2 are loose already after a month. However, I must mention I have 23 kids. ( Classroom). Worth it to me for how many you get.
customer_reviews.author: JSM

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: These are horrible! They are not worth the price! I feel cheated.These should at most be a dollar a puppet and then I wouldn't be so mad! Half of the puppets mouths do not move and the cardboard used in the mouths are bent and inoperable. Do not buy! This is a waste of money. I will return these ASAP. Too expense and poor quality! I don't understand how these received one good review.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I was on a budget and I wanted puppets. The are poorly made. Some of the mouths don’t move correctly. I wanted to sell them, however, my mentor suggested that I could use them as an example for people who may have problems speaking.
customer_reviews.author: N. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Hand puppets for Children
customer_reviews.text: These are just as pictured. They are good quality, but not professional grade puppets. (Eyes do not have pupils, hair is sparse, holes for hand are small.) However, these are perfect for a child who wants cool hand puppets and the price can't be beat. I would recommend then to anyone looking to provide variety for a home puppet theater, preschool, etc.
customer_reviews.author: KloT

customer_reviews.title: I bought these to go with the puppet theater for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go with the puppet theater for my 6yr old grandson. He's going to have a blast naming each one and thinking up his little shows. I also bought the two wooden plate racks to hold them up on his dresser and to organize his shows with them.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Cute for imaginative play
customer_reviews.text: The puppets are cute but a little poor in quality. One of the puppets noses fell off before we even played with it. But it was easy to fix and my son loves his new puppet friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Polseno

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality product
customer_reviews.text: Real bad quality products When they say Kids Hand puppets, they are really for kids - even teenager can not use them hand opening is for 5-7 year old kids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great puppet set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who was 7 when I bought the puppets. We have the Melissa and Doug puppet theater, so this was a great addition. I had spent a while trying to find puppets that were people not animals, and when I found this set I had to get it. I would recommend this to anyone who has an imaginative child who enjoys putting on shows as this set allows them to create many different characters.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Puppet Ministry Sure to Be a Hit with These!
customer_reviews.text: Hello everyone. I have to say after looking and pricing puppets to use with my new puppet ministry, it was a relief to find these! They are a good price, and will work great for me. It will allow me to have several different characters in the skits I will present to children between the ages of 5 and 15. I also purchased the Kindle version of Puppets and People: Skits for Children's Church Programs by David M. Karr. Thanks for offering this product and for helping me out! We own and operate a 501(c)(3) non-profit youth camp, so anything I can do to keep costs down really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Good, A Bit Hard to Use
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for to use with my clients (not as toys, but as therapy tools.) The mouths are a bit hard to make open and close, that's my only complaint. Love the different genders and cultures. Well made (but I wouldn't just let a kid "play" with them as they would any toy.)
customer_reviews.author: Creatress

customer_reviews.title: How they were used and loved in the lesson.
customer_reviews.text: Love them, used them in the classroom virtually and the children loved them. That was very important to me. I tried them and they worked!
customer_reviews.author: vera Thompson

customer_reviews.title: So much potential, but the execution is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Pro: ethnic mix, girls in both dresses and pants and girls with both short and long hair Cons: Very poor quality. Mouths look like they would be functional but are not. Arms are not functional. Adults can only get 2 fingers into the heads to control them. My toddlers were not impressed. Neither was I.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: YES!
customer_reviews.text: These are way nicer than I expected. Bigger too. I'm really excited to use them in my junior high theater classes this year and next. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: TXODork

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas gift ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my girls for their new puppet theatre. I only hoped that they would get used, unlike many other toys that just get tossed aside. These puppets are used not only in the theater, but all around the house, as my kids explore their imagination. They've been tossed around, grabbed, pulled, and probably stepped on, and they are still in great condition. Eventually we'll be able to add the cultural aspect of the different puppets, but my kids are still a bit young to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Home Maid Simple

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: This product was not made very well. The yarn hair was falling out when it arrived, i do not believe these will last long. The price was quite high for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Decent puppets
customer_reviews.text: They could use a little more room to actually make the puppets mouths move but really good for the value
customer_reviews.author: Pretty Vicki

customer_reviews.title: I saw a lot of poor reviews, so I didn't expect the greatest quality
customer_reviews.text: I saw a lot of poor reviews, so I didn't expect the greatest quality. They are perfectly fine. Not the greatest quality but a better value than I expected. The kids love them and use them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Scanlon

customer_reviews.title: Cute and fun
customer_reviews.text: These are not the best quality craftsmanship. But they are cute and fun! My 4 kids, all ages love them!
customer_reviews.author: Creative Duo

customer_reviews.title: So cute
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great love these puppets Was better then I had expected
customer_reviews.author: Michele Martin

customer_reviews.title: Recipes For Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are adorable! As teachers of preschoolers on the autism spectrum, we are constantly looking for cute, fun ways to show diversity and inclusion. These puppets fit the bill perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: 4inclusion

customer_reviews.title: My 9 yr old daughter is a puppet freak and these are wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 yr old daughter is a puppet freak and these are wonderful! With the great price, I thought they may end up being shabby or itsy bitsy - but they are a great size and very good quality! These guys make lots of fun expressions. I would purchase more puppets like these in different styles.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with these puppets! They are cute and fairly large and best of all; machine washable! I love the fact that they each look different, kind of like the kids in our preschool classes. The teachers love them and are coming up with all sorts of ways to use them. One of the toddlers just hugs one and treats it like her doll. She even slept with it at nap time the whole week it was in the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price for 8 puppets
customer_reviews.text: Love these they are hilarious good price for the amount you get, I have small hands so I’m able to use them decently, my husband has a difficult time using them though, our daughters love them, they are much easier for kids to use
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great if starting out
customer_reviews.text: Very tight fit for large hands. Moving mouth complete closure is not fluid. Great deal for volume puppets. Great place to start.
customer_reviews.author: Wahl

customer_reviews.title: Lovee these puppets!
customer_reviews.text: We had so much fun playing with these puppets! I bought all eight for my granddaughter. For the next several days, they slept with her, played with us and were better that hand puppets as they work well as dolls too!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: ... for Christmas and needed some puppets to complete the fun. These are great
customer_reviews.text: Sewed my daughter a doorway puppet theater for Christmas and needed some puppets to complete the fun. These are great! Not super well made but perfect for children! I love that they come in lots of diverse colors of us. They made them in all skin colors! Great teaching tool. L❤️️VE!
customer_reviews.author: FlyJ

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money. Difficult to fit med size hand in puppet. Also note thread connecting nose visible. Some puppets were not very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sunday School
customer_reviews.text: These puppets will be perfect for our Sunday School's activity room this year. They are a great size for children. Like the mix of boys and girls and different races, which was the deciding factor in my purchase. For the price, these are fine quality for children. I like the yarn hair--it's cute!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift to 3 year old. She liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S

customer_reviews.title: They are cheaply made but they are still good to use with children
customer_reviews.text: They are cheaply made but they are still good to use with children. I'm not afraid for the kids to play with them because they were so cheap. If they tear them up oh well can buy more.
customer_reviews.author: kay smith

customer_reviews.title: Love these puppets!
customer_reviews.text: Love these happy faces and the variety of girls and boys!
customer_reviews.author: Karyl

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Designed for small kids
customer_reviews.text: These puppets were not what I expected. I purchased them for use in Sunday School ministry but none of the teachers or older kids (9 yrs and over) could comfortably place their hands into them. They seem to be designed for small hands... probably for kids under 8 yrs old. However, they are reasonable enough in quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basic puppet with very poor mouth design.
customer_reviews.text: These were not what I expected. The picture makes them look well made and they are not. The mouths on these puppets are poorly made and are hard to control. These look cheap and I will use them to either give away to kids or I will make changes to them to use them. These cannot be used as they are not without some fixing. But on the other hand...you get what you pay for. They were cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these puppets
customer_reviews.text: great quality can't wait to use them in my classroom
customer_reviews.author: pearly burton

customer_reviews.title: worked well for a puppet theatre for the grandkids. ...
customer_reviews.text: worked well for a puppet theatre for the grandkids. . .made Biblical costumes to go over the ones made for puppets. Mouths Made for kids or small hands, but could still be functional for adults by just moving the head and body or using tips of hands to move mouth somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: Puppets for Contest
customer_reviews.text: They worked well, but not all of the mouths moved correctly. Hair is a little crazy on some of the puppets and gard to determine if it is a boy or girl.
customer_reviews.author: tony grimes

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Sunday school class I am very disappointed with the quality and poor effort in the making
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The quality is so so.
customer_reviews.text: Too big for my hands and quality just not good enough. Some of them are broke already.
customer_reviews.author: wendy whitt

customer_reviews.title: Fun times with puppets
customer_reviews.text: I bought these puppets to use at a kids camp for the drama centre. I found that some kids had a hard time fitting their hand inside the puppets and by the end of the week some of the seams were coming apart. However we were using them everyday and the kids had a blast! The nice thing is that for the price I would easily buy/recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Emogirl

customer_reviews.title: but it's a good price for 8 puppets and I love that they ...
customer_reviews.text: I would probably give 4.5 starts. They don't last forever, but it's a good price for 8 puppets and I love that they are multiple ethnicities. We use them a lot at our language center.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was expecting more
customer_reviews.text: The puppets are a little bit on the cheap side. It is a little snug on my hand. And the mouths don't work properly. But the kids loved
customer_reviews.author: Tayane Becker

customer_reviews.title: Good for Sunday school
customer_reviews.text: I like this I wish they were a little bigger and that’s better compare to other places that are so expensive
customer_reviews.author: Bren18

customer_reviews.title: They are fine for 1st-timers!!!
customer_reviews.text: I know people are giving these a poor review but for kids learning about puppets and imaginative play- they do the job! They are cute and fun to play!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mouth hard to open and close.
customer_reviews.text: The price and presentation of this puppets are fine, the problem is that the the puppet's mouth is so soft that it doesn't allow you to open and close it accurateley, no matter who experienced your may be and how well you manipulate puppets.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Hoyos

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but SMALL
customer_reviews.text: Cute puppets, but smaller than expected. Only SMALL childs hands fit in them.
customer_reviews.author: DRmom

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: This was such an amazing deal for so many puppets, couldn't find this price anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Stevens

customer_reviews.title: They are ok. Wasnt impressed, poorly made but ...
customer_reviews.text: They are ok. Wasnt impressed, poorly made but for the purpose it will do. Hair was thin and skippy.
customer_reviews.author: Tameka Jiles

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made puppets
customer_reviews.text: The mouths are messed up and I ended up safety pinning them for a few weeks before giving them to our daughter for her birthday. That fixed some of it. Also, it's hard to get my (slightly smaller than average) hands into the puppets comfortably. And my husband can't at all. Plus they aren't exactly the most durable of materials/construction. But they will work decently for a three year old who wants to be a muppet when she gets bigger, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Libby Ann

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for high quality puppets, you probably won't want these. However, for us they serve their purpose well. You get a lot of puppets for a good price. Our little ones don't notice the sparce hair and are just happy to have puppets for their new stage! If they continue to be interested in doing puppet shows, we may invest in higher quality puppets. Note: The mouths are a little tough to open and close, but when my kids put on shows they don't really try to use the mouths, so it doesn't cause then trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Rae Shaughnessy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered a set of these puppets several years ago and was very pleased with the quality and value. This time I was very disappointed. Puppet hair was not finished off as before...ribbons, pig tails. The black boy has only two rows of ringlets with the middle of the head being bald. The mouths this time we're not flat but crinkled up,making it difficult to use properly. I would have returned them but needed them before a new set could have been delivered. Very disappointed in the lack of quality and workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and so cute!
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to tell that the kids I bought these for LOVED them! Sadly their mother and my sister in law is not a fan of me so I have heard nothing. Anyway I thought they were adorable and larger than I expected. My little boy got all excited when he saw them and thought they were for him. We ordered another set and he loves playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Our puppets had the hair falling out the first time my children played with them. and the seam ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Nastya

customer_reviews.title: Great selection of different ethnicities
customer_reviews.text: These are from Oriental Trading company but very cute. Great selection of different ethnicities, something for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: TrisT

customer_reviews.title: Yuck they don't deserve stars
customer_reviews.text: This item sucked I returned it.......the faces were flat......and I could barely fit my hand inside the head and I'm a woman.......with a normal sized hand.........these Puppets would scare my students.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Rakama

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: These puppet are very poorly made. There are no holes for the arms to put your fingers in and the mouthpieces inside are sewn so crooked that the mouths are inoperable as well (you can't open or close the mouths. The yarn hair is falling out as well. I am very disappointed but not surprised, as they were made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Puppet Show in the days of Covid-19
customer_reviews.text: In a time when live theater isn't an option, I was able to provide entertainment to my loved ones by putting on a short puppet show of a scene from a Broadway show. These puppets are wonderful!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap
customer_reviews.text: These came from oriental trading company and are very cheap. Would be good for a classsroom but would only last one academic year
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Badger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made for the cost and very useful working with children.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Puppets
customer_reviews.text: Daughter had this thing about being a vantriliquist (msp). Cute.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction but still works
customer_reviews.text: Well I must say the quality is not very good. They truly look as though a bunch of material was cut and sewn together without much care. Same goes for the filling in the arms and legs. Not to mention the mouths are also poorly constructed. However, I did keep them and I have used them in quite a few therapy sessions already so they do serve their purpose. I just don't forsee them lasting very long.
customer_reviews.author: vmhkns

customer_reviews.title: Pricey from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Little disappointed in price from Amazon it was $10 more than Oriental Trading. Same puppets. They are nice puppets and the children will enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Super Cute and Super Fun
customer_reviews.text: Just received our puppets today and had to post a review right away because they are so much cuter than expected. I have a feeling our kids are really going to enjoy putting on puppet shows with these!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Z.

customer_reviews.title: These puppets are perfect for little kids hands up to maybe 10 years ...
customer_reviews.text: These puppets are perfect for little kids hands up to maybe 10 years old. An adult hand will fit also, but your hand will get tired faster than a large puppet.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Lynn Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price! My 3 year old granddaughter loves them.
customer_reviews.author: GrannyBeBe

customer_reviews.title: Everyday diversity
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter to use when teaching Sunday School. I chose them because they all look like children, and I wanted puppets that could represent peers rather than traditional costumes. I like that they are rather cartoon-like and dressed similarly so that they are not overtly from different countries, just portraying some of the lovely diversity of hair and skin tone in which children are made. My daughter says that,"They are SOOO cute!" With their wide, easy-to-manipulate mouths, these are great for teachers to use as well as for children to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Knits

product_meta.title: Happy Kids Hand Puppets Multi Ethnic and Diversity Collection (Set of 8) Great for Daycare and Classrooms
product_meta.description: 8 Plush Happy Kids Hand Puppets. Each of these delightful fabric puppets has a working mouth with a huge smile, embroidered features and durable, sewn-on clothing. They are perfect for school classrooms, day cares or church groups! They also make fun friends to give each guest at a child's birthday party! Put a smiling puppet on your hand and put on a puppet show! 14" Machine washable. NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN UNDER 3.
feature_bullets: Kids will have fun for hours playing with these plush Happy Kids Hand Puppets.Great for therapy professionals, daycare, teachers and at home.
Each of these delightful hand puppets has a working mouth with a huge smile, embroidered features and durable, sewn-on clothing.
8 hand puppet set. Comes in a wide variety of skin tones and hair colors for a realistic representation of today's multi ethnic and diverse groups of children.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars622 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
